com.anotherservice.rest.core

Class Router

  • Object
    • Router

  • public class Router
extends Object
    This class loactes the proper Handler for the REST service and execute() it.
    It relies on the Config key : com.anotherservice.rest.core.helpActionPath (if not set, "help" is used as value).
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele
    See Also:
    Request

    • Method Detail

      • forward

        public static Object forward(String path)
                      throws Exception
        Forwards the request to a new Handler. This method calls forward(String, boolean) with alias set to false.
        Parameters:
        path - the Handler mapping
        Throws:
        Exception

      • forward

        public static Object forward(String path,
             boolean alias)
                      throws Exception
        Forwards the request to a new Handler. If the path may be absolute or forward-relative to the current Handler (no "../")
        Parameters:
        path - the Handler mapping
        alias - if true, the last traversed path fragment is discarded
        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        Exception

      • route

        public static Object route()
                    throws Exception
        Finds and executes the proper Handler.
        You should not need to call this method manually. The Servlet does it for you
        Based on the Request information, the Router traverses the handlers starting at Handler.getRoot() and follows the mapping chain until no further Handler is found. Then, the Handler.execute() method is called.

        If the path encounters the helpActionPath keyword defined in the Config the help for the nearest instance is directly sent as a response without calling the execute method and without continuing the routing loop.
        If the execute method returns a Handler instance, then the help for that instance will be sent as a response.
        If the execute method throws or returns an exception, then it will be processed and sent as a response.

        Returns:
        the response
        Throws:
        Exception - if the Handler is not an Index or Action or if the current path is inconsistent (i.e. after a forward())
